Explanation of the Tags Used:

: Sets the title of the page that appears on the browser tab.

<marquee>: Creates scrolling text (Note: <rarcuce> is obsolete and not
recommended for modern web practices, but included here as per the requirement).
<h1> to <h6>: Represent different levels of headings.

<p>: Defines a paragraph.

<hr>: Inserts a horizontal line.

<br>: Adds a line break.

<blockquote>: Used for longer quotations or to indicate a block of quoted text.
<pre>: Displays preformatted text, preserving both spaces and line breaks.

9. Logical styles: <p>, <i>, <u>, <sub>, and <say> are used for bold, italic, underline,
subscript, and superscript text, respectively.

3. Develop an extemal style sheet named as “style.css” and provide different styles for h2,
h3, hr, p, div, span, time, img & a tags. Apply different CSS selectors for tags and

Program
style.css

/* Universal selector for basic styling */
*{

margin: 0;

padding: 0;

box-sizing: border-box;

}

/* Styling for h2 tag */

h2{
color: #2¢3e50; /* Dark blue color */
font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
font-size: 24px;
margin-bottom: 20px;

}

/* Styling for h3 tag */
h3{
color: #163085; /* Teal color */
font-family: ‘Courier New', Courier, monospace;
font-size: 20px;
text-transform: uppercase;

}

/* Styling for horizontal rule */
br{
border: none;
height: 2px;
background-color: #3498db; /* Blue color */
margin: 20px 0;
}

/* Styling for p tag */

et
color: #34495e; /* Grey color */
font-family: Georgia, serif;
font-size: 16px;
line-height: 1.1
margin-bottom: 15px;

ATMECE, MYSURU PAGE 37

WEB TECHNOLOGY LAB BCSLS504

}

/* Styling for div tag */
div{
background-color: #ecfOf1; /* Light grey background */
border: 1px solid #bdc3c?; /* Border color */
padding: 15px;
margin-bottom: 20px;
border-radius: 5px;

}

/* Styling for span tag */

span {
color: #e74c3c; /* Red color */
font-weight: bold;

}

/* Styling for time tag */

time {
color: #9b59b6; /* Purple color */
font-style: italic;

}

/* Styling for img tag */
ime t{
max-width: 100%;
height: auto;
border: 2px solid #3498db; /* Blue border */
border-radius: 10px;
}

/* Styling fora tag */

at
color: #2980b9; /* Blue color */
text-decoration: none;
font-weight: bold;

}

a:hover {

text-decoration: underline;

color: #1f618d; /* Darker blue on hover */
}

Explanation of the CSS Styles and Selectors:

1, Universal Selector (*):
9 Applies basic margin, padding, and box-sizing to all clements, ensuring
consistency across different elements.
2, Element Selector (h2, h3, hr, p, div, span, time, img, a):
9 Targets specific HTMI. elements to apply general styling.
3. 2:
9 Sets color, font-family, font-size, and margin for h2 headers.
4. n3:
9 Applies color, font-family, font-size, and text transformation to n3 headers,

9 Styles horizontal rules with background color, height, and margin.
9 Defines color, font-family, font-size, line-height, and margin for paragraphs.

9 Adds background color, border, padding, margin, and border-radius to div

elements.
8. span:
9 Styles ssan clements with color and font-weight.
9, time
9 Applies color and font-style to zi-ne elements,
10. img:

9 Sets maximum width, auto height, border, and border-radius for images,
ensuring responsiveness,

lla
9 Styles links with color, removes underline by default, and adds bold font
weight.
9 a:hover pscudo-class changes the link appearance when hovered over, adding
underline and changing the color.
Applying the Styles

To use these styles in an HTMI. document, link the style.css file in the <need> section of
your HTML. file:

<html lang="en">
<head>
<meta charset="UTF-8">
<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
<title>Styled Page

Explanation of the HTML and CSS:

1, HTML Structure:
9 The form is placed inside a div with the class ferm-centeiner for styling.
9 A table is used for layout alignment, with cach row containing labels and
corresponding input fields.
9 Various input types (text, enail, password, select, textarea) are included
to demonstrate different form elements.
2, CSS Styles:
9 body: Sets a background color and padding for the entire page.
9 table: Centers the table and sets its width, Uses berder-col lapse to ensure
borders are collapsed into a single line.
th: Styles table headers with a background color and white text.
td: Styles table data cells with a light grey background.
label: Styles labels with font size and color.
input, select, textarea: Applics styles to form clements including padding,
border, and font size.
9 input(type="submit"): Styles the submit button with a green background,
white text, and hover effect,
9 .form-container: Adds padding, background color, border radius, and box
shadow to the form container for a card-like appearance,
9 .form-titla: Styles the form title with font size and color,
